page.title: 04LITTLE CHART PAPER MILL
page.content: Batchelors Paper Mill is one of the few mills in the country producing flong for the newspaper industry. They use high fibre paper such as computer paper and make it into a pulp by adding wood pulp, Cal Flo and china clay. This is mixed with water in beaters. They use about 50,000 gals. of water a day which is recycled and comes from the mill stream. The pulp is dried on rollers and 14 layers make one sheet of flong.Fungicides are added and the paper is then cut to size and rolled to give a smooth surface. The finished paper then goes to the newspaper industry where it is used to make the moulds for printing. About 80% is sent to Africa and India and the rest to Fleet Street, London.
